newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent slips lower as Iraq oil looms.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent slips lower as Iraq oil looms.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures continued their downwards drift on Wednesday as physical crude markets weakened in the face of imminent Iraqi oil exports, traders and brokers said.
"It looks like Iraqi oil is on the way and that has hit the cash market - sentiment is a bit weaker," one IPE broker said.
September Brent was 24 cents a barrel weaker at $19.28 at 1135 GMT while August gas oil was $1.75 weaker at $174.50.
Brent contracts for differences (cfds) for next week were 10 to 12 cents weaker - indicating weakness in the price of prompt physical North Sea cargoes.
Iraq's oil minister Muhammed Rasheed told reporters in Baghdad on Wednesday his country would begin exports under the latest oil-for-food deal with the U.N. in mid-August.
He indicated that Iraq's export capacity stood at 1.8 million barrels per day.
"This all makes it a bit volatile but the news is basically already in the market," one trader said.
Dealers saw technical support at $19.00 and then $18.80 a barrel, with next resistance up at $19.64.
